item.title: The Laplace approximation
item.description: For any model more complex than some well studied examples, an exact description of the posterior is computationally intractable. Beyond an exhaustive evaluation, approximate inference makes it possible to retrieve reasonable descriptions of a posterior or cost surface based on approximation methods. While for many models, Markov chain Monte Carlo is the approximate inference method of choice, the Laplace approximation still provides the simplest deterministic method available. Simply put the Laplace approximation entails finding a Gaussian approximation to a continuous probability density.
